page.title: 01SALTCOATS and STEVENSTON
page.content: SALTCOATS and STEVENSTON are small towns in the{CUNNINGHAME DISTRICT}of {NORTH AYRSHIRE.}The towns have a {coastal site}and a Southerly aspect. Both towns have a rural hinterland although neither has an agricultural character. {SALTCOATS}used to be a commercial {port}and{holiday resort}but both these functions have declined and now the town's main function is as a{shopping {centre}for a fairly large area which includes the neighbouring towns of ARDROSSAN and STEVENSTON. { STEVENSTON}is about{1km from the sea, separated from the shore by an area of sand dunes and poorly drained land. This poor land provided the site for the{I.C.I.chemicals factory}- the main employer. The study area covers part of both towns - page titles use only{SALTCOATS
